result.execSummary:
The defendant Loretta A Behl was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver THC (<=200g), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(h)1.
  • Maintain Drug Trafficking Place, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.42(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Probation may be transferred to Jefferson County.
Concurrent with: Count 2

miscConds.notes:
Court costs, DNA surcharge and Buy Money to be paid as a Condition of Probation. (Buy Money to be paid to Waukesha Co. Drug Metro Unit)

If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.
Maintain full time employment and/or combination of schooling.
Submit to an AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment/counseling recommended by Agent.
NOT GRANTED BY THE COURT ON THIS CASE.

Maintain absolute sobriety.
Submit to random alcohol/drug screens.
Not to use or possess of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription or any drug paraphernalia.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment/counseling recommended.
Any other conditions deemed appropriate by Agent.
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

timeConds.notes: Condition Time - nonoworking hours. Report to Huber by 3/09/2016 at 5pm. May be transferred to Jefferson County - NO ELECTRONIC MONITORING.

Random Listing Report - Voir Dire.
Voir Dire List.
Signed by Judge Aprahamain on 1/29/16 that the stipulation and agreement is the order of the Court regarding the chain of custody.

Defendant Loretta A Behl in court with attorney Steven John Luchsinger.  David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.The Court addresses the jury instructions and witnesses (housekeeping issues).  Neither party filed a motion in limine.  The trial is expected to last one day.  There will be a total of 12 jurors chosen.  Each side will be allowed 4 strikes each.  The witnesses will be excluded during testimony.  The Court will permit note taking by the jurors and the court will allow juror questions.  A stipulation has not been reached regarding chain of custody.  Both parties do not have an objection to proposed jury instructions.  Charging language agreed on by both parties.  Jurors enter the room in 8:50 a.m.   The Court presents introductory remarks.  Clerk swears panel of jurors.  Court conducts voir dire.  State conducts voir dore. Defense conducts voir dore.  Counsels exercise 4 strikes each.  The following 12 jurors are selected to try the issues:   Nicholas V., Laura S., Jennifer O., Ann K., Carrie K. Kristin P., Robin J.., Heather V., Mary M., Jeremy C., William H., Faye H.  The balance of the jurors return to the JAR.  The Clerk swears the selected jurors.  The Court presents preliminary instructions to the jurors.  Jurors removed and Court is in recess.   Court reconvenes without the presence of the jurors.  The parties have reached a stipulation in chain of custody but there are not additional motions to be heard.  The jurors enter the courtroom.   The State and Defense present opening statements.  The State calls its first witness:  Detective Nicholas Welch of the Waukesha County Sheriff's Department is sworn in and testified. The witness is questioned by the State.   Exhibit S4 is marked and presented to the witness and Exhibit S7 is marked and presented to the witness.  Exhibit S1 is marked and presented to the witness.    Exhibits S1, S4 and S7 are marked, offered and admitted into evidence.   Exhibit S2 is marked, offered.   and admitted into evidence.  Exhibits S5 and S8 are marked, offer and admitted into evidence.  The witness is questioned by the Defense.  The parties have a side bar outside the presence of the juror.  The questioning continues by Attorney Luchsinger.  Re-direct by the State.  Exhibit S9 is marked, offered and admitted into evidence.  The witness is excused.    The State calls witness: Deputy Chadwick Niles is sworn in and testified.  The witness is questioned by the State.  The witness is questioned by the Defense.   Redirect by the State. Redirect by the Defense.   The jurors do not have a questions from Detective Wells.   The witness is excused.  The Jurors does not have any questions for Officer 1st.  The State calls Wisconsin Crime Lab analyst Jeffrey Zwickey.  The witness is sworn in and testified.  The State questions the witness.  Exhibit S3 is marked, offered and admitted into evidence. The witness is questioned by the Defense.  Re-direct by the State.   Re-direct by the Defense.  The jury does not have any questions for the witness.  The witness is excused.  The jurors are excused at 12:00 for lunch and are to return at 12:15.  The Court off the record addresses the sidebar regarding the identification of the confidential informant.  Exhibit 6 is marked but is not received or offered by the State. The parties are excused at 12:05 p.m. and are to return at 1:15.   The Court reconvenes at 1:17 outside the presence of the jurors.  The Court addresses the jury instructions and both parties are in agreement with the jury instructions.  Both parties agree to the stipulation that Detective Robert Grall and Detective Christopher Kohl will not be called as witnesses and will not testify.  Both parties do not object to the verdicts that will be provided to the jurors.  The Court conducts plea colloquy with the Defendant.  The Defendant will not testify.  The jurors enter the courtroom at 1:30 p.m.  The State recalls Deputy Nicholas Welch and is questioned by the State and by the Defense.  The witness is excused.  The State and the Defense both rest.  The State presents its closing arguments.  The Defense presents its closing arguments. The State presents brief rebuttal arguments. The Court reads the jury instructions to the jury. The Clerk swears in the bailiff in charge of the jurors.  Jurors retire to the jury room for deliberation. Exhibits 7&8 are returned to the State proper inventory. Court reconvenes 2:40 p.m. The jurors reached a verdict at 245 p.m.    Jurors find the Defendant guilty on Count 1 and Count 2.    Defense does request jurors be polled.   The Court polls the jurors.  The State moves for judgment on the verdicts.  The Court enters judgment on the verdicts.  Bail remains as set.  The Court sets the matter for sentencing in about 30 days.
State's Proposed Jury Instructions.

Defendant Loretta A Behl in court with attorney Steven John Luchsinger.  Steven Centinario appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Luchsinger advises the Court they are ready to proceed to trial.  Attorney Luchsinger does not intend to call witnesses and will not be filing a motion in limine. The jury instructions are to be filed with the Court by close of business on Friday, January 15, 2016 and a copy provided to Attorney Luchsinger.  The Court will let the parties know by 3:00 p.m. on Monday if the trial will proceed.   The trial is expected to last one day.
Filed by the State. Witness list attached.
